item.title: Bootiful error handling with @ControllerAdvices
item.description: Introduction Today we’re going to look at how to return pretty error responses for our REST APIs, using Spring Boot's controller advices. Even though controller advices are a well-known mechanism, no many projects use them to their full potential. In this article we’ll try to fix that. The REST api Initially, we’ll need a couple of HTTP endpoints, so that we can simulate some errors and see if we as users of that REST api can understand what went wrong.
